name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Cream sugars and shortening together.
Add eggs and vanilla, mix util combined.
Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt and add to cookie mixture.
Mix until combined. Add chocolate chips, mix.
Scoop dough into inch dollops onto cookie sheet, two inches apart.
Bake for 8-10 minutes or until edges are golden brown.

name: Bowtie Pasta- with Sausage, Peppers and Feta
ingredients: 3 cups red pepper, ¼ inch thick slices
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Add 1 tsp salt to water before boiling.
Drain pasta in a colander, saving about ½ cup of the cooking water.
Heat oil in large nonstick pan over medium high heat.
Add bell peppers and ½ tsp salt.  Saute for 2 minutes.
Add sausage, oregano, and garlic to pan.
Cook 4 minutes or until sausage is done, stirring to crumble sausage.
Add pasta, cooking water, ¼ tsp salt, feta cheese, olives and black pepper.
Cook for 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated, stirring frequently.

name: Honey Sriracha Chicken
description: Sweet and spicy chicken with a sticky glaze
ingredients: 3-4 small chicken breasts, diced (or 2 large breasts)
instructions: Add bell peppers and ½ tsp salt.  Saute for 2 minutes.
Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat.
Whisk together the 2 tablespoons of corn starch and remaining 2 tablespoons of water until dissolved.
Add to sauce pan and stir until thickened.  Reduce heat to low.
Add diced chicken and 1/3 cup cornstarch to large plastic bag.
Seal the bag and shake to coat chicken.
Drizzle a large pan or skillet with oil over medium heat.
Add chicken and saute until browned and chicken is cooked through.
Add the sauce to the pan and stir to coat chicken.

name: Ohana Honey Coriander Wings
description: Chicken wing recipe from the Polynesian
ingredients: ½ cup low sodium soy sauce
instructions: Combine kosher salt, paprika, sugar, pepper, turmeric, cinnamon, garlic, and cayenne together in a mixing bowl.
Add wings and mix well to coat wings evenly.
Place chicken on a baking tray evenly spread out.
Let marinate in fridge for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 475 Cook wings for 35 to 40 minutes or until the outside is crispy and wing are 165 internally.
While wings are in the oven, begin sauce with lime juice, soy sauce, and honey.
Sprinkle spices into pot and whisk constantly to avoid clumping.
Heat over stovetop  to a boil and let simmer for 1 minute.
Combine water and cornstarch.
As sauce is simmering, add cornstarch and water solution.
Continue to summer until sauce is thick.
When wings are done, combine wings and sauce in a clean mixing bowl and toss to evenly coat wings.

name: Peanut Butter Balls
ingredients: 1 Cup of Peanut Butter (can use crunchy)
2 cups of Rice Krispies or crushed corn flakes
instructions: Mix together peanut butter and butter.
Add powdered sugar, and coconut.  Mix until combined.
Add cereal.  Mix well.
Roll into one inch balls and freeze.
Melt chocolate chips in a bowl and add a tablespoon of butter or oil.
Dip frozen balls in chocolate and place on cookie sheet lined with wax paper or parchment.
Cool in fridge or freezer.
